body:
Hm... I can't reproduce this on the latest master.
What I did was selecting the vertical bars as you did (select filter: ` \|`) afterwards I pressed `r<ret>` but that worked fine.
Also `a<ret>` worked fine for me.
Hm... may I ask if you can provide some minimal reproduction steps? Am I doing something wrong?
Sorry, realised that I forgot to mention the selection collapse before inserting return. (Visible in the asciinema though.) You're correct in that it does not reproduce the error if left out.

Hm even if I collapse the selection (I hope we talk about the same by pressing `;`) I'm getting no panic:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b693ec54-1b22-493a-836b-fb080f198190

Yeah, `;' should be right. (I've got mine bound to escape.)

How did you paste in the snippet? I think you need to paste it on an "EOF line that does not yet exist". See how I in the recording paste it at the `~`  line.

Alright, so here's a full video of my steps:


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ee92a850-1ac7-4fb7-9a92-54cf277e6fd3

I'm currently on the master branch. May I ask if you can try the latest master branch as well?

Still not pasting onto the last line. Notice how I go down one line down in my recording before pasting. ðŸ˜Š

No, official release, as mentioned in the top comment.

Ok, I think that I'm too stupid for this....

![bonk](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/078daf93-860d-4dcf-8de7-b8565f1171c4)

maybe someone else should investigate this

issue.title: fix: panic on newline insert
issue.body:
Had to rewrite the function in order to properly fix this bug

Closes https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/issues/12495
Closes https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/issues/12461

body:
Ok, so this issue is also related to https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/issues/12495. I managed to fix it in https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/pull/12510

When I solved my issue, that was most of the story. But there was still a bug which I wouldn't have found if not for your issue. When I came across this issue, I tried your example, and found the bug that my PR would've introduced. The bug I fixed in https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/pull/12510/commits/903b10de9a331d21787c832fa6b91f1cdd7f1f6c, it's a very small change but that also means it can be really hard to figure out.

So I added your input to the integration test suite, and it works now!

issue.title: [Rust] Making new comment lines sometimes gives weird results.
issue.body:
### Summary

With 25.01, adding a new line after a comment/doc comment prepend the relevant comment prefix to the new line. This seems to give weird results in some cases

### Reproduction Steps

I began with the following code in Rust

```Rust
/// Details of an IPv4 address.
#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct Ipv4Details {}

/// Details of an IPv6 address.
#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct Ipv6Details {}
```

I wanted to add a line in the doc comments of both that they're currently unused and only exist for completeness. So I put my only cursor after the period on the IPv4 comment, then alt-clicked to place a new cursor after the period on the IPv6 comment.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a82abbd4-8341-43d7-b3f4-eae4bfe52216)

After this, I pressed enter twice, and had the following code:

```Rust
/// Details of an IPv4 address.
///
/// 
#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct Ipv4Details {}

/// Details of an IPv6 address.
///
/// 
#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq, Serialize, Deserialize)]
pub struct Ipv6Details {}
```

While the text is as expected and the cursor for the IPv4 comment was at the end of the doc comment's third line as expected, the cursor for the IPv6 comment was over the `#` of the derive invocation.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d6392b88-bbd0-402a-b7ab-f7e41d95ec50)

Reversing the order of cursors gives the exact same result, with the IPv6 comment giving the weird result

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a69d320e-fa43-45bf-8271-19a8355fe362)


### Helix log

<details><summary>~/.cache/helix/helix.log</summary>

The log doesn't contain any lines past 2025-01-04, so I assume it's not relevant. Also I doubt any of the code involved has any reason to print to the log.

</details>


### Platform

Linux, Kubuntu 24.10, KDE Plasma 6.1.5

### Terminal Emulator

Konsole 24.08.1

### Installation Method

Snap

### Helix Version

25.1 (dabfb6ce)
